title: set the log is applied when the exception occurred during applying
body:
if an exception occurred during applying, the log would not be applied forever, and the server would be blocked.
this pr is to try to fix the problem.

    under the License.

-->

<!-- Thanks for trying to help us make Apache IoTDB be the best it can be! 
Please fill out as much of the following information as is possible (where relevant, and remove it 
when irrelevant) to help make the intention and scope of this PR clear in order to ease review. -->

## Description

This PR try to fix the bug in the method `canSkipDelete` about the skip logic.

# Detail
if the TsFileResource has start with T1 and T2, that's [T1, T2],  when we try to delete a range [T3, T4]
if T3 <= T2 **or** T4 >= T1, we can make sure the two range has intersection, and `canSkipDelete` should return false

The reason why this bug has not been triggered is that the parameter of [T3, T4] is [Long.Min, Long.Max], and the expression T3 <= T2 and T4 > T1 is always true. but if the input value changed, error may occur

title: Fix zeppelin bug on Show Storage Group
body:
## Description
Fix bugs on query statements that ignore timestamps, namely, the result's first column is not `time`.

### Changing executeQuery
Referring to `org.apache.iotdb.cli.AbstractCli`, use `isIgnoreTimeStamp` to justify whether the result table has a timestamp column.

### Adding Test
Including:
* testShowAllTTL
* testShowDevices
* testShowStorageGroup
* testShowTimeseries
* testShowTTL
* testShowVersion 

### Code Optimization 
Encapsulate `stringBuilder.deleteCharAt(stringBuilder.length() - 1)` everywhere into the function `deleteLast(StringBuilder stringBuilder)`

<hr>

This PR has:
- [x] been self-reviewed.
- [x] test zeppelin on MacOS 10.14.1, Chrome  87.0.4280.141.
- [x] added integration tests.
- [x]  added unit tests or modified existing tests to cover new code paths, ensuring the threshold for code coverage.

<hr>

## Key changed/added classes
* org.apache.zeppelin.iotdb.IoTDBInterpreter
* org.apache.zeppelin.iotdb.IoTDBInterpreterTest

title: Remove versionInfo in Tsfile and get rid of versions in memtable
body:
IoTDB uses an incremental field "version" to keep track of the updating order of multiple Memtables, and this version is also persisted into TsFiles.
This PR targets to remove the "version" field in Memtables and avoid serializing/deserializing it into TsFiles.

Design docsï¼š
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=173082421

title: [IOTDB-1104]put all query error caused by incorrect sql  are not Server internal error any more and not printted in Tests
body:
<!-- Thanks for trying to help us make Apache IoTDB be the best it can be! 
Please fill out as much of the following information as is possible (where relevant, and remove it 
when irrelevant) to help make the intention and scope of this PR clear in order to ease review. -->

## Description

1. Now the CI print too many meaningless log, see https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/IOTDB/issues/IOTDB-1104
2. Some error are just caused by incorrect SQL, they should not be marked as "Server Internal Error".

3. Some RestartTests failed because the compaction module does not allow clear the MManamger before it is stopped.
see #2426  https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/2426/checks?check_run_id=1650191463 and 
#2425  https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/2425/checks?check_run_id=1649494523

## How to fix

1. I define a new Logger in TsserviceImple, called `DETAILED_FAILUER_QUERY_TRACE`, and use it to print the errors except for the NullException, Exception, and AuthException.

2. The logger is in the `ERROR` level in Tests and the `WARN` level in `src/assembly`
 
3. I replace many `System.out` and `printStackTrace` in Tests with `logger.debug`.

4. Move  `IoTDB.metaManager.clear();` out of `IoTDB.shutdown`

repo.name: iotdb
repo.description: IoTDB (Internet of Things Database) is a data management system for time series data, which can provide users specific services, such as, data collection, storage and analysis. Due to its light weight structure, high performance and usable features together with its seamless integration with the Hadoop and Spark ecology, IoTDB meets the requirements of massive dataset storage, high throughput data input, and complex data analysis in the industrial IoT field.

title: Switch Zeppelin connector from Session to JDBC
body:
## Switch Zeppelin connector from Session to JDBC
Previous implementation use `Session` to connect IoTDB, which has to judge whether someone SQL is a query or update.
JDBC enables the zeppelin interpreter to pass the SQL to the server and then use `hasResultSet` to determine the result format. As a result, the zeppelin interpreter has supported `show timeseries` now.

### Content1:  Session to JDBC
The functions related to connection, SQL parsing, and SQL result presentation.
### Content2: test
Fix bugs about time display type and time zone.

<hr>

This PR has:
- [x] been self-reviewed.


<hr>

##### Key changed/added classes (or packages if there are too many classes) in this PR

Change `open()`, `cancel()` and `close()` related to the connection.
Change function `#internalInterpret()`, add `handleInputCmd()` and `executeQuery`. remove `getResultWithCols()`.

Design: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IOTDB/Separate+memory+and+disk+management+in+storage+group+road+map+design

title: [IOTDB-1071] Built-in UDF registration service
body:
If we want to write a built-in function by writing a UDF in the future, and require this function to be automatically loaded when the system starts and cannot be unloaded by the user, we need a special built-in UDF function registration service.

JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1071

repo.name: iotdb
repo.description: IoTDB (Internet of Things Database) is a data management system for time series data, which can provide users specific services, such as, data collection, storage and analysis. Due to its light weight structure, high performance and usable features together with its seamless integration with the Hadoop and Spark ecology, IoTDB meets the requirements of massive dataset storage, high throughput data input, and complex data analysis in the industrial IoT field.

title: [To rel/0.11] compaction not block flush
[Distributed] Fix init serialToParallelPool bug if cpu.cores > 100
body: We will encounter a exception when starting cluster server if cpu.cores > 100, so we should change the parameters for ThreadPoolExecutor. As serialToParallelPool will only do heartbeat or add/remove node, I think the coreSize can be 'allNode.size()', and the maxSize can be set to `Math.max(allNodes.size(), Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors())`.

title: [Distributed] Fix init serialToParallelPool bug if cpu.cores > 100
body: We will encounter a exception when starting cluster server if cpu.cores > 100, so we should change the parameters for `ThreadPoolExecutor`. As `serialToParallelPool` will only do heartbeat or add/remove node, I think the coreSize can be 'allNode.size()', and the maxSize can be set to `Math.max(allNodes.size(), Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors())`.

title: [IOTDB-1090] Unable to update UDF
body:
How to reproduce:

1. CREATE FUNCTION example as "org.apache.iotdb.udf.UDTFExample"
2. DROP FUNCTION example
3. modify your code in UDTFExample
4. repackage the UDF and upload it 
5. CREATE FUNCTION example as "org.apache.iotdb.udf.UDTFExample"

The behavior of the newly registered UDF will not be any different from the old UDF.

JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1090
